intro: Espeletia uribei, commonly known as the Uribé espeletia, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andes mountains of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant is typically found in high-altitude grasslands, where it thrives in cool, dry conditions. Its rosette-shaped foliage is adapted to conserve moisture and withstand strong winds. Espeletia uribei is noted for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated for its unique appearance.
